com.streambase.sbunit.ext.matcher.builder

Class JSONMatcherBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.streambase.sbunit.ext.matcher.builder.JSONMatcherBuilder

  • public class JSONMatcherBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    Build matchers to match a subset of a tuple's fields from JSON strings. Any fields that aren't mentioned in the constructor are ignored. Some of this code is "borrowed" from TupleJSONUtil, where there are some private classes "JSONFunctions" and setTuple() (molded to include matcher.*() methods). IMPORTANT NOTE: this code is single threaded (synchronized makeMatcher()) as handling of lists is non-reentrant (class global variable "handlingAlist"). This is OK as very high performance is not critical in Unit testing This matcher builder builds it's matcher on a FieldBasedTupleMatcher, so that fields can be ignored, etc

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JSONMatcherBuilder(com.streambase.sb.Schema inSchema)
      create a Matcher that has a companion partial JSON string that mentions each node that will be of interest in the match

      Set the fields of a tuple based on the contents of a JSON object >> similar to TupleJSONUtil.setTuple(), but handles depth of matching in subtuples TODO: is there a way to do similar for lists? This is not evident in FieldBasedTupleMatcher, so a bit tricky i think

    • Method Detail

      • makeMatcher

        public FieldBasedTupleMatcher makeMatcher(java.lang.String columns)
                                   throws com.streambase.sb.StreamBaseException
        Build a matcher from string values that matches only the fields given to the constructor. Note that either a null column or an empty string matches a null field similar to TupleJSONUtil.getTuplesFromJSON()
        Parameters:
        columns - String value for each column matching the field names in the constructor
        Returns:
        The Matcher for this JSON row.
        Throws:
        com.streambase.sb.StreamBaseException

      • setTupleAndMatcher

        public com.streambase.sb.Tuple setTupleAndMatcher(com.streambase.sb.Tuple tuple,
                                         java.lang.Object jsonObject,
                                         java.lang.String fieldParent)
                                           throws com.streambase.sb.StreamBaseException
        Set the fields of a tuple based on the contents of a JSON object >> similar to TupleJSONUtil.setTuple(), but handles depth of matching in subtuples TODO: is there a way to do similar for lists? This is not evident in FieldBasedTupleMatcher, so a bit tricky i think
        Parameters:
        tuple - the tuple to set
        jsonObject - the JSON object; must have at least the fields of the tuple's schema
        Throws:
        com.streambase.fastjson.JSONException
        com.streambase.sb.StreamBaseException
